plot: Sam Kittredge accidentally discovers that his prospective son-in-law fought in the Civil War.

Walter Jameson is a successful history professor. He's been teaching for 12 years and has proven to be very popular with his students for his ability to bring his subject to life. He is engaged to Susanna Kittridge, his good friend Professor Sam Kittridge's daughter. One thing that Professor Kittridge has noticed about Walter is that he doesn't seem to have aged one bit in the 12 years they have known each other. Walter admits that he is far older than anyone can imagine but before he and Susanna can elope, someone from his past pays him a visit.—garykmcd / edited by Rob

Walter Jameson is a history professor at a college. He is engaged to marry the daughter of Professor Kittridge, a colleague and friend. Kittridge is intrigued at Jameson's almost personal knowledge of historic events. Things get complicated when Jameson reveals that he is over 2,000 years old.—grantss / edited by Rob
